710182-d-05-29-11-IC.Narrative: L50071-29 WAS IN THE PROCESS OF HUMPING MR01, WHICH WAS INBOUND BN TRANSFER CUT. AFTER HUMPING 54 CARS, THE YARDMASTER NOTICED THAT TRACK MO40 WAS FULL AND THERE WERE 2 MORE CARS ROLLING DESTINED FORTHE SAME TRACK. THE YARDMASTER REACTED AND APPLIED PROTECTION TO TRACK MO40,  WHICH LOCKED THE TRACKOUT AND LINED THE 2 ROLLING TANKS MO41. TRACK MO40 WAS FOULING MO41. HPCS ALLOWED THE YARDNASTER TOPROTECT M040, EVEN THOUGH IT WAS IN THE FOUL OF M041, AND LINED THE SWITCH TOWARDS M041, WHEN THISOCCURRED, CAR NATX 252178 CORNERED AND DERAILED THE B END OF NATX 252179 (NORTH CAR IN M040). THE YAEDMASTER WAS TESTED FOR CAUSE AND A FORMAL INVESTIGATION WILL BE SCHEDULED.

20110501-d-05-25-11-BKRR.Narrative: LEADING WHEELSET OF 10TH RAILCAR FROM ENGINE, A LOADED COVERED HOPPER, CEFX 11057, CONTAINING CORN GERM MEAL, DERAILED. THE RIGHT WHEEL FLANGE, B1, (WITH HARD CORNER AND DEEP TOOLING MARKS AT TOP OF FLANGE FACE) CLIMBED TO TOP OF RIGHT RAIL ON LEFT HAND SUPERELEVATED 2 DEGREE CURVE. THE FLANGE TRAVELED IN A STRAIGHT PATH ATOP THE CURVED RAIL APPROXIMATELY 30', THEN DROPPED OUTSIDE THE RAIL, ONTO THE OPEN DECK OF A GIRDER BRIDGE. THE REMAINING WHEELSETS OF THIS CAR DID NOT DERAIL. THIS DERAILED CAR CONTINUED APPROXIMATELY 30' ON THE BRIDGE AND APPROXIMATELY 380' FURTHER, DAMAGING TRACK AND SPREADING GAGE BEYOND THE BRIDGE. THE NEXT 5 CARS, ALL LOADS, DERAILED IN THE DAMAGED TRACK BEYOND THE BRIDGE. 3 OF THESE CARS OVERTURNED. THE REMAINING SECTION OF TRAIN, 3 LOADED CARS, DID NOT DERAIL. THE FACE OF THE WHEEL FLANGE THAT HAD CLIMBED THE RAIL WAS FOUND TO HAVE CONTINUOUS SURFACE IRREGULARITIES; GOUGING, PITTING, AND SCALING, INDICATIVE OF EXCESSIVE ABRASION FROM CHEWING AGAINST THE RAIL.ADDITIONALLY, CHARACTERISTIC MARKS, INDICATIVE  OF FLANGE CLIMB AND DROP, WERE FOUND IN 3 PLACES ONTHE VISIBLE SECTION OF WHEEL FLANGE WHERE THE CAR CAME TO REST. (NOTABLY, THE OPPOSITE FLANGE OF THIS DERAILED WHEELSET WAS IN EXCELLENT CONDITION, FACE AND PROFILE). SUBSEQUENT INVESTIGATION OF THISCAR, AFTER RERAILED AND MOVED TO LEVEL TRACK (FOR REPAIR), REVEALED THAT ALL 4 OF THE EQUIPED MINERTYPE TCC 8000 CONSTANT CONTACT SIDE BEARINGS WERE OVER PRELOADED BEYOND THEIR OPERATING HEIGHT RANG

226082-d-05-14-11-SOO.Narrative: 483-13 OPERATING IN A 25 MPH SLOW ORDER FROM BNSF MP 107.3 TO MP 106.6 WHEN WE LOST OUR AIR. LOOKEDBACK & OBSERVED LEAD CAR WAS ON THE GROUND. PLOW CAME FELL OFF TRAILING UNIT (CP 4522) WHICH RESULTED IN LEAD CAR (SHPX 450270) DERAILING. BNSF PRELIMINARY COSTS OF $30,000 TRACK DAMAGE (WHICH INCLUDES $1,000 SIGNAL) T499 - CAUSE OF DERAILMENT STARTED APPROXIMATELY .5 MILES SOUTH AT 1ST AVE. THE CROSSING AT 1ST AVE E. IS A CONCRETE CROSSING ON STATE HWY 95. THE NORTH RAIL IN THE CROSSING HAS A DE-FRACTION FROM THE TOP OF THE RAIL TO THE TOP OF THE CROSSING PANEL OF 2 TO 2.5 INCHES. BECAUSE OF THIS THE REAR LOCOMOTIVE CP 4522 PLOW IMPACTED THIS CROSSING, DETACHED ON THE CONDUCTORS SIDE AND WASDRAGGED FOR APPROXIMATELY .5 MILES TO THE NEXT CROSSING, EMERSON ST N. 000089038-d-05-09-11-CSX.Narrative: NOPB RR TRAIN PB200 WAS DELIVERING THE KCS. THEY WERE INSTRUCTED TO COME OUT OF FRANCE YARD INTO THEPAS TRACK. THE YARDMASTER INSTRUCTED THE INDUSTRIAL CANAL DRAWBRIDGE TENDER TO LINE SIGNALS UP FROMFRANCE YARD INTO THE PAS TRACK. THE DRAWBRIDGE TENDER GAVE PB200 PERMISSION BY THE STOP SIGNAL IN ACCORDANCE WITH OPERATING RULE 226-B AND INSTRUCTED THE CREW THAT HE WAS NOT GETTING AN INDICATION OFHOW THE #3 SWITCH WAS LINED. THE BRIDGE TENDER FURTHER INSTRUCTED PB200 TO LINE THE #3 SWITCH FOR THEIR MOVEMENT. PB200 REPEATED THE INSTRUCTIONS BACK CORRECTLY. AS PB200 APPROACHED THE #3 SWITCH THEY CHECKED TO MAKE SURE THE SWITCH WAS LINED FOR THEIR MOVEMENT BUT NEVER TOOK THE SWITCH OFF OF MOTOR. AFTER TRAVERSING THE #3 SWITCH IN A NORTHWARD DIRECTION PB200 REPORTED FEELING A BUMP FROM THE ENGINES. UPON INVESTIGATION, PB200 HAD PULLED 3 ENGINES AND 15 CARS OF A 102 CAR TRAIN OVER THE #3 SWITCH AND 5 CARS HAD DERAILED.

000089171-d-05-10-11-CSX.Narrative: L16310 CREW HAD CUT AWAY FROM THEIR HEAD 19 CARS THAT WERE INBOUND FROM STATEN ISLAND, LOCATED ON PORT NEWARK TRACK 1. OPERATING LITE ENGINE TO PNCT YARD EAST TRACK. THEY PROCEEDED TO DOUBLE 12 CARS OFF THE EAST TRACK ONTO 10 CARS ON WEST TRACK. THE CREW PULLED THE 22 CARS OFF THE WEST TRACK (LENGTHAPPROX 4800 FEET) AND CUT THE CARS OFF IN THE CLEAR ON ELEVEN LEAD TRACK; JUST SOUTH OF THE SIGNALAT CP PN.  THIS MOVE ELIMINATED THE LONG DOUBLE FROM PORT NEWARK YARD TRACK 1 BACK TO THE PNCT YARD.ONCE THEY WERE COUPLED BACK ONTO TRACK 1 AND THEIR TRAIN AIRBRAKES WERE CHARGED, THE CREW BEGAN TO PULL NORTH TOWARDS CP PN ONTO THE NORTHERN CONNECTION TO DOUBLE THE 19 CARS (LENGTH APPROX 4200 FEET) ONTO THE 22 CARS LEFT ON TRACK 11 LEAD.  DURING THE SHOVING MOVE SOUTH FROM THE NORTHERN CONNECTION AT CP PN TO TRACK 11 LEAD IN PNCT YARD (APPROX 1900 FEET) THE CONDUCTOR FAILED TO PROPERLY CONTROL THE MOVE TOWARDS THE COUPLING WHEN HE DID NOT MAKE A SAFETY STOP. THIS ACTION RESULTED IN A HARDCOUPLING WHICH CAUSED THE WEST RAIL TO ROLL APPROX 1500 FEET NORTH OF THE LOCATION OF THE COUPLING IN THE 10 DEGREE CURVE ON THE NORTHERN CONNECTION. THE CONDUCTOR WAS UNAWARE THAT HE HAD A WHEEL ON THE GROUND, THE 9TH HEAD CAR DERAILED TO THE WEST SIDE. THE ADDITIONAL DAMAGE AT CP GARDEN WAS CAUSEDWHEN L16310 ATTEMPTED TO DEPART, PULLING APPROX 700 FEET WHEN THE TRAIN EXPERIENCED A UDE.

I050411-d-05-04-11-PATH.Primary Accident Cause: Other causes relating to train handling or makeup (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I050411-d-05-04-11-PATH.Contributing Accident Cause: Other train operation/human factors (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I050411-d-05-04-11-PATH.Accident Cause: Other causes relating to train handling or makeup (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I050411-d-05-04-11-PATH.Narrative:
AT APPROXIMATELY 0915 HOURS, A SEVEN-CAR PA-5 TRAIN CONSIST WAS BEING RELAYED ONTO TRACK 8 IN A YARD.  AS THE TRAIN APPROACHED THE BUMPING BLOCK, LEAD CAR 5741SLID 23 FEET PAST THE ‘7’ CAR MARKER, ANDSTRUCK THE BUMPING BLOCK.  THE FORCE OF THE IMPACT PUSHED THE BUMPING BLOCK WEST APPROXIMATELY 10 FEET.  WHEN THE TRAIN CAME TO REST, THE NO. 1 END ANTI CLIMBER OF CAR 5741 WAS RESTING ATOP THE BUMPING BLOCK, AND ALL WHEELS OF THE NO. 1 TRUCK OF CAR 5741 WERE OFF OF BOTH THE NORTH AND SOUTH RUNNINGRAILS.

DAMAGES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS INCIDENT ARE:  WAY & STRUCTURES- $24,347.00; CAR EQUIPMENT $9,532.00.  THERE WERE NO REPORTED INJURIES AS A RESULT OF THIS ACCIDENT.

AN INVESTIGATION WAS UNDERTAKEN TO DETERMINE THE CAUSAL FACTORS INVOLVED IN THIS ACCIDENT.  THIS INCLUDED PHYSICAL EVIDENCETHAT WAS GATHERED AT THE SCENE OF THE ACCIDENT, EQUIPMENT TESTS AND INSPECTIONS TRACK AND RELATED TRACK COMPONENTS, AND CAR EQUIPMENT SYSTEM COMPONENTS.    THROUGH THE ANALYSIS OF ALL INFORMATION THATHAS BEEN ASSEMBLED,  IT HAS BEEN DETERMINED THAT THE PROBABLE CAUSE OF THIS COLLISION WAS THE FAILURE BY THE ENGINEER TO PROPERLY CONTROL HIS TRAIN AS IT ENTERED TRACK 8 IN A YARD WHILE APPROACHING THE BUMPING BLOCK.

I050111-d-05-08-11-PATH.Primary Accident Cause: Other causes relating to train handling or makeup (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I050111-d-05-08-11-PATH.Contributing Accident Cause: Other train operation/human factors (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I050111-d-05-08-11-PATH.Accident Cause: Other causes relating to train handling or makeup (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I050111-d-05-08-11-PATH.Narrative:
AT APPROXIMATELY 0832 HOURS ON MAY 8, 2011, THE 0820 33RD STREET TO JOURNAL SQUARE VIA HOBOKEN INTERVAL TRAIN WAS MOVING INTO HOBOKEN TERMINAL ON TRACK 2.  AS THE TRAIN ENTERED THE TERMINAL, IT PASSEDTIMING SIGNAL 94Z, AND STARTED TO ACCELERATE.  AN EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION WAS INITIATED APPROXIMATELY TWO SECONDS BEFORE LEAD CAR 853 STRUCK THE BUMPING BLOCK AT THE EAST END OF THE TERMINAL.  THE LEAD CAR MOVED PAST THE 7 CAR MARKER, AND STRUCK THE BUMPING BLOCK.  THE FORCE OF THE IMPACT SEVERELY DAMAGED THE BUMPING BLOCK, AND THE SURROUNDING CONCRETE ON THE PLATFORM AT THE NORTH END OF THEBUMPING BLOCK.  IN ADDITION, SEVERAL TURNSTILES WERE DAMAGED.  BOTH THE NORTH AND SOUTH RAILS ATTACHED TO THE BUMPING BLOCK BROKE AWAY AT THE INSULATED JOINTS, AND WERE PUSHED 5 FEET EAST.  THE NO. 1AXLE OF LEAD CAR 853 REMAINED ON THE RAILS, AND THE NO. 2 AXLE DERAILED FOUR INCHES TO THE SOUTH.  CAR 853 SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO THE NO. 1 END ANTI-CLIMBER, FIBERGLASS BONNET, PANTOGRAPH GATES, DRAFT GEAR, INCLUDING THE COUPLER ASSEMBLY, AND ELECTRIC PORTION.  THE OTHER SIX CARS SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO DRAFT GEAR SHEAR BOLTS, AND ANTI CLIMBERS.  

DAMAGES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS INCIDENT ARE:  WAY & STRUCTURES- $276,000.00; CAR EQUIPMENT $76,617.78.  AS A RESULT OF THE COLLISION, 32 PASSENGERS, AND BOTH THE ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR SUSTAINED INJURIES.

0511DV007-d-05-04-11-UP.Remote Control Locomotive: Remote control portable transmitter - more than one remote control transmitter
0511DV007-d-05-04-11-UP.Narrative: YDV71R-04 WITH AN ENGINEER, WENT INTO THE NORTH END OF 18 TRACK LIGHT POWER TO COUPLE UP TRACK.  AFTER MAKING A JOINT ON THE NORTH CAR, THE SWITCHMAN HAD THE ENGINEER STRETCH THE CUT.  AFTER PULLING AHEAD 5 CARS, MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED DUE TO SOUTH CARS NOT COUPLED.  SWITCHMAN WALKED TO CAR NEEDING AJOINT, STARTED THE ENGINEER MOVING BACK 10 CARS, THEN 2 AND THEN STATED THAT WILL DO (STOP), AT THESAME TIME, YDV34R-04 WAS PULLING CARS DOWN THE SOUTH END OF THE LEAD, WHEN THE FOREMAN NOTICED THE CARS ROCKING.  DV34R FOREMAN STOPPED BOTH JOBS.  IT WAS FOUND THAT THE CARS IN 18 TRACK ROLLED OUT TOFOUL AND SIDESWIPED DV34S CUT.

0511ES001-d-05-02-11-UP.Primary Accident Cause: Motor car or other on-track equipment rules (other than main track authority) - Failure to Comply.
0511ES001-d-05-02-11-UP.Accident Cause: Motor car or other on-track equipment rules (other than main track authority) - Failure to Comply.
0511ES001-d-05-02-11-UP.Narrative: HYRAIL PICKUP 67051, OPERATED BY SYSTEM MATERIAL FM CDL OPERATOR, WAS STOPPED AT MP 43.1 TO PICK UPTHE QC FOR THE DAY.  THERE WAS ONE TOO MANY QUALITY CONTROL (QC) PEOPLE TO FIT IN TRUCK SO HE CALLEDBR666 OPERATOR TO COME WEST TO PICK UP ONE OF THE QC.  HE GOT OUT OF THE TRUCK TO FLAG BR666; TWO OF THE QC GOT IN THE HYRAIL.  THE 67051 WAS ON THE WESTEND OF A 311 FT STRETCH OF TANGENT TRACK WITHA CURVE 676 FT TO THE EAST.  THE BR666 CAME WESTBOUND AROUND THE CURVE AND EMPLOYEE TRIED TO FLAG ITTO STOP FROM A POINT 243 FT EAST OF THE 67051.  ANOTHER EMPLOYEE WAS ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE HYRAIL PICKUP AND TOLD EVERYONE TO GET OUT OF TRUCK; EMPLOYEES GOT OUT JUST AS THE BR666 COLLIDED PLOW-END FIRST INTO THE FRONT OF THE TRUCK.  RAIL = CWR

TC0511113-d-05-06-11-BNSF.Narrative: CREW SHOVING INTO TRACK 5 DERAILED AT TRACK 2 SWITCH. INVESTIGATION INDICATED ELECTRIC SWITCH MECHANISM FAILED ALLOWING SWITCH TO OPEN UNDER MOVEMENT. NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS RELEASED.

0511CB001-d-05-02-11-UP.Narrative: YCB21R-02 KICKED TWO CUTS OF RAILCARS FOR A TOTAL OF SIX RAILCARS INTO TRACK 10 AND THEN WENT BACK AND KICKED TWO RAILCARS TO TRACK 2, ONE RAILCAR TO TRACK 30 AND TWO RAILCARS TO TRACK 3.  THE FOREMANTHEN RODE THE SHOVE TO THE NINE SWITCH AND GOT OFF THE RAILCARS AND LINED THE SWITCH FOR A MOVEMENTTO 9 TRACK.  THE FOREMAN THEN STARTED INTO 9 TRACK BEFORE HE REALIZED THAT THE RAILCARS HE HAD LEFTIN 10 TRACK WERE FOULING 9 TRACK.  HE STOPPED TOO LATE RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO THREE RAILCARS.  NO DERAILMENT OCCURRED.
